      • getSessionObject

        public java.lang.Object getSessionObject(java.lang.String NAME)
        Gets object stored in request (replaces call of request.getAtribute())
        Parameters:
        NAME - an object name in request
        Returns:
        Object from request if found, otherwise NULL will be returned

      • setSessionObject

        public boolean setSessionObject(java.lang.String NAME,
                                java.lang.Object object)
        Stores object in request. (replaces call of request.setAtribute(name, object))
        Parameters:
        NAME - an object name in request
        object - an object to be stored
        Returns:
        always true

      • getLoggedUser

        public final User getLoggedUser(boolean refresh)
        Use to get an fresh version of actually logged-in user.
        Parameters:
        refresh - Boolean true = get refreshed account from hibernate / false = get cached object
        Returns:
        An instance of User entity (logged in user) or null

      • getLoggedUser

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setLoggedUser

        public final boolean setLoggedUser(User user)
        Saves User to session (this means an user is logged-in succesfully)
        Parameters:
        user - to save in session
        Returns:
        true on sucess

      • logoutUser

        public final void logoutUser()
        Logouts current user

      • getSessionRole

        public final UserRole getSessionRole()
        Retieves current session role. An non-logged-in user role is (by defualt) GUEST Logged-in user returns current user role. For an blocked users (by admin), this function automatically downgrades user role to GUEST
        Returns:
        An role of User

      • getJSON

        public final org.json.JSONObject getJSON()
                                  throws UnknownActionException
        Parses JSON object from request
        Returns:
        JSON object from request or null if not present
        Throws:
        UnknownActionException - if json is not available in request

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • ExceptionToResponseJson

        public static void ExceptionToResponseJson(java.lang.Throwable exception,
                                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                           boolean append)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Converts exception into JSON and writes into response.
        Parameters:
        exception - An exception
        response - An servlet response to be written to
        append - true - append into output, false - try to arase output ease output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown on unsucces write to reponse

      • jsonResponse

        public static void jsonResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                java.lang.Object toJson,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,java.lang.Class<?>> filters,
                                boolean flush)
                         throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerationException,
                                com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Converts object to JSON format and writes to response
        Filter in Map is defined:
        Parameters:
        response - HttpServletResponse target response to write JSON object
        toJson - Object an object to be written to JSON
        filters - Map filters to be applied to output
        flush - Boolean true = sets content type and closes response. false = appends to response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerationException
